member.summary: Dequeues an item from the queue or waits asynchronously until an item is available.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.AsyncQueue`1.DequeueAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Dequeues an item from the queue or waits asynchronously until an item is available. The wait can be cancelled using the given CancellationToken.
member.param: A CancellationToken with which a dequeue wait can be cancelled.
member.returns: A Task which can be awaited until a value can be dequeued.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.ObjectExtensions.ToOneOrZeroString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a boolean to a "1" or "0" string. Particularly helpful when sending telemetry

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.NullableExtensions.HasTrue(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Extension method to evaluate a bool? and determine if it has the value and is true. This way we avoid throwing if the bool? doesn't have a value.
member.param: The bool? to process
member.returns: true if has a value and it is true false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.ExceptionExtensions.IsOperationCanceledException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true if the passed exception or any inner exception is an OperationCanceledException instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.GeneralRequestDetails.TryParseEnum``1(System.Type,System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: This method exists because in NetStandard the Enum.TryParse methods that accept in a type are not present, and the generic TryParse method requires the type T to be non-nullable which is hard to check. This is different to the NetCore definition for some reason. It seems easier to implement our own than work around this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.GeneralRequestDetails.Options
member.summary: Gets or Sets the options

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.LogEvent
member.summary: Ordinal value of each LogEvent value corresponds to a unique event id to be used in trace. By convention explicitly specify the integer value so that when this list grows large it is easy to figure out enumeration corresponding to a numeric value. We could be reserving ranges of values for specific areas or logEvents. Maximum value assignable to LogEvent enum value is 65,535.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger

member.summary: Calling this method will turn on inclusion CallStack in the log for all future traces

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger.StopCallStack
member.summary: Calling this method will turn off inclusion of CallStack in the log for all future traces

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger.Flush

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger.WriteWithCallstack(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the log file with accompanying callstack.
member.param: The level at which the message will be written.
The message text to be written.
member.remarks: The callstack logging gets turned on globally and any other log writes that happens in the time window while this log write is happening will also get callstack information logged. This is not considered and trying to isolate the callstack logging to be turned of for just one call is unnecessarily complex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger.WriteWithCallstack(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.LogEvent,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the log file with accompanying callstack.
member.param: The level at which the message will be written.
The event id enumeration for the log event.
The message text to be written.
member.remarks: The callstack logging gets turned on globally and any other log writes that happens in the time window while this log write is happening will also get callstack information logged. This is not considered and trying to isolate the callstack logging to be turned of for just one call is unnecessarily complex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Logger.Write(System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType,Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.LogEvent,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the log file.
member.param: The level at which the message will be written.
The event id enumeration for the log event.
The message text to be written.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.SqlToolsTraceListener
member.summary: This listener has the same behavior as TextWriterTraceListener except it controls how the options: TraceOptions.DateTime, TraceOptions.ProcessId and TraceOptions.ThreadId is written to the output stream. This listener writes the above options, if turned on, inline with the message instead of writing them to indented fields as is the case with TextWriterTraceListener. This implementation also lazily initializes the underlying tracelistener
member.remarks: Implementation of this is a lazily initialize trace listener that is partly inspired by: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30664527/how-to-stop-streamwriter-to-not-to-create-file-if-nothing-to-write

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.SqlToolsTraceListener.Close
member.Summary: Closes the so that it no longer receives tracing or debugging output. Make sure that we do not Close if the lazy listener never got created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.SqlToolsTraceListener.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the No unmanaged resources in this class, and it is sealed. No finalizer needed. See http://stackoverflow.com/a/3882819/613130 We skip disposing if the lazy listener never got created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.ProcessExitTimer.Start(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a thread that checks if the provided parent process has exited each time the provided interval has elapsed. Once the parent process has exited the process that started the timer also exits.
member.param: The ID of the parent process to monitor.
The time interval in milliseconds for when to poll the parent process.
member.returns: The ID of the thread running the timer.

parameter is 0-based
parameter is 0-based

parameter is 0-based

parameter is 0-based

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.ThreadSynchronizationContext.EndLoop
member.summary: Ends the SynchronizationContext message loop.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate
member.summary: Provides common validation methods to simplify method parameter checks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate.IsNotNull(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Throws ArgumentNullException if value is null.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The value of the parameter being validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate.IsWithinRange(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Throws ArgumentOutOfRangeException if the value is outside of the given lower and upper limits.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The value of the parameter being validated.
The lower limit which the value should not be less than.
The upper limit which the value should not be greater than.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate.IsLessThan(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Throws ArgumentOutOfRangeException if the value is greater than or equal to the given upper limit.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The value of the parameter being validated.
The upper limit which the value should be less than.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate.IsGreaterThan(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Throws ArgumentOutOfRangeException if the value is less than or equal to the given lower limit.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The value of the parameter being validated.
The lower limit which the value should be greater than.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlTools.Utility.Validate.IsNotEqual``1(System.String,``0,``0)
member.summary: Throws ArgumentException if the value is equal to the undesired value.
member.typeparam: The type of value to be validated.
member.param: The name of the parameter being validated.
The value that valueToCheck should not equal.
The value of the parameter being validated.

The value of the parameter being validated.
